level.text: DCHA will make two attempts to contact the owner of a vehicle that has been issued a Notice of Infraction for being parked on DCHA’s Property as provided for under Section 9704 above. The attempts will be no less than twenty-four (24) hours apart.
If DCHA is unable to contact the owner of a vehicle after two attempts, DCHA will proceed with the removal of the vehicle from DCHA Property.
If the vehicle is not removed from DCHA Property within 72 hours of the issuance of the Notice of Infraction and Warning Notice, DCHA will have the vehicle removed by contacting either:
The District of Columbia Department of Public Works, Abandoned and Junk Vehicle Division; or
A tow crane operator licensed with the District of Columbia.”

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 51 DCR 2112, 2114-2115 (February 27, 2004).
